popt4jlib.neural

Class CategoricalXEntropyLossW

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.neural.BaseNNNode
      • popt4jlib.neural.CategoricalXEntropyLossW
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, NNNodeIntf, OutputNNNodeIntf

    public class CategoricalXEntropyLossW
extends BaseNNNode
implements OutputNNNodeIntf
    same as the CategoricalXEntropyLoss class, but when used as the output node, divides the value of the input of the node corresponding to the true label by the sum of the input signals of all its inputs.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CategoricalXEntropyLossW()
      (sole) public constructor is a no-op.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights)
      computes and returns the index in inputSignals argument that has the largest value.
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset)
      same as eval(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold all the network weights.
      double eval(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_label)
      called when the node is used as output node, and returns the cross-entropy of the given input data instance, for the network with the given weights PLUS the true label value.
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights)
      same as eval(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold the bias of the node as well (goes unused).
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset)
      same as evalB(s,w) method, but the 2nd argument is now assumed to hold as last element the bias term for this node (still goes unused).
      double evalB(double[] inputSignals, double[] weights, int offset, double true_label)
      called when the node is used as output node is exactly the same as eval(inputSignals,weights,offset,true_label).
      java.lang.String getNodeName()
      get this node's name.
